method.name: PingStart
method.tp:docstring: Starts pinging the specified hostname with the specified options, with output directed to the given output file descriptor. The returned opaque string functions as a handle for this particular ping. Multiple pings can be running at once.

arg.name: outfd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to send output to.

arg.name: destination
arg.tp:docstring: Destination host to connect to.

arg.name: options
arg.tp:docstring: Options to pass to the ping command. Accepted keys include: broadcast (bool): Send broadcast pings. count (int default 4): Number of packets to send. interval (int): Time to wait between packets. numeric (bool): Print numeric remote hosts. packetsize (int): Size of each packet sent. v6 (bool): True for ipv6. waittime (int): Time to wait for a response. Unrecognized keys return a DBus error and print no output to the supplied file descriptor.

arg.name: handle
arg.tp:docstring: Opaque handle for this ping.

method.name: PingStop
method.tp:docstring: Stops a running ping.
method.arg: Handle to the ping to stop. If an empty string is passed, stops all running pings.

method.name: SystraceStart
method.tp:docstring: Start system/kernel tracing. If tracing is already enabled it is stopped first and any collected events are discarded. The kernel must have been configured to support tracing.

arg.name: categories
arg.tp:docstring: Trace event categories to enable. If none are specified then all known events are enabled. Multiple categories are specified separated by spaces.

method.name: SystraceStop
method.tp:docstring: Stop system/kernel tracing and write the collected event data.

arg.name: outfd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to send event data to.

method.name: SystraceStatus
method.tp:docstring: Return current status for system/kernel tracing including whether it is enabled, the tracing clock, and the set of events enabled.
method.arg: Free-form text reporting status.

arg.name: outfd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to send output to.

arg.name: destination
arg.tp:docstring: Destination host[/port] to trace a path to.

arg.name: options
arg.tp:docstring: Options to pass to the tracepath command: numeric (bool): Print numeric remote hosts. v6 (bool): True for ipv6. Unrecognized keys return a DBus error and print no output to the supplied file descriptor.

arg.name: handle
arg.tp:docstring: Opaque handle for this ping.

method.name: TracePathStop
method.tp:docstring: Stops a running tracepath.

arg.name: handle
arg.tp:docstring: Handle to the tracepath to stop. If an empty string is passed, stops all running tracepaths.

method.name: GetIpAddresses
method.tp:docstring: Returns the IP addresses.

arg.name: options
arg.tp:docstring: Options: v6 (bool): True for IPv6.

arg.name: result
arg.tp:docstring: The list of address output.

method.name: GetRoutes
method.tp:docstring: Returns the routing table.

arg.name: options
arg.tp:docstring: Options: numeric (bool): Deprecated, numeric hosts are always given. v6 (bool): True for ipv6.

arg.name: result
arg.tp:docstring: The list of routes.

method.name: GetNetworkStatus
method.tp:docstring: Returns network information as a JSON string. See the design document for a rationale.

arg.name: status
arg.tp:docstring: Network information as a JSON string.

method.name: GetPerfOutput
method.tp:docstring: Runs system-wide perf profiling. The profile parameters are selected by perf_args.

arg.name: duration_sec
arg.tp:docstring: Duration to run perf in seconds.

arg.name: perf_args
arg.tp:docstring: The perf parameters to pass to quipper, which will forward them to perf after checking they are safe.

arg.name: status
arg.tp:docstring: Status code from running perf and serializing the output.

arg.name: perf_data
arg.tp:docstring: Perf report output data as a protobuf.

arg.name: perf_stat
arg.tp:docstring: Perf stat output data as a protobuf.

method.name: GetPerfOutputFd
method.tp:docstring: Runs system-wide perf profiling. The profile parameters are selected by perf_args. This method runs quipper asynchronously so that debugd isn't blocked for duration_sec. The DBus client reads the perf output using the file descriptor. Only one profiler session is allowed to run using this method. Calling this method while the profiler is running yields a DBus error. The profiler session can optionally be stopped using method StopPerf before duration_sec elapses.

arg.name: duration_sec
arg.tp:docstring: Duration to run perf in seconds.

arg.name: perf_args
arg.tp:docstring: The perf parameters to pass to quipper, which will forward them to perf after checking they are safe.

arg.name: stdout
arg.tp:docstring: quipper's stdout will be connected to this file descriptor.

arg.name: session_id
arg.tp:docstring: The identifier of the profiler session. Will be non-zero if the profiler is started successfully. It can be used in method StopPerf to stop the profiler and gather output right away.

method.name: StopPerf
method.tp:docstring: Stop the existing profiler session and gather perf output right away. If the collection started by GetPerfOutputFd has finished, calling this method will silently succeed.

arg.name: session_id
arg.tp:docstring: The profiler session ID returned from the GetPerfOutputFd method. It is used to stop the existing profiler session.

method.name: GetPerfOutputV2
method.tp:docstring: Runs system-wide perf profiling through quipper. The profile parameters are selected by quipper_args. This method runs quipper asynchronously so that debugd isn't blocked for however long perf is recording. The DBus client reads the perf output using the file descriptor. Only one profiler session is allowed to run using this method. Calling this method while the profiler is running yields a DBus error. The profiler session can optionally be stopped early using method StopPerf.

arg.name: quipper_args
arg.tp:docstring: Quipper arguments including the recording duration and perf parameters that quipper checks for safety before forwarding them to perf.

arg.name: disable_cpu_idle
arg.tp:docstring: If true, temporarily disable all CPUs from entering the idle states while running the perf command.

arg.name: stdout
arg.tp:docstring: quipper's stdout will be connected to this file descriptor.

arg.name: session_id
arg.tp:docstring: The identifier of the profiler session. Will be non-zero if the profiler is started successfully. It can be used in method StopPerf to stop the profiler and gather output right away.

method.name: DumpDebugLogs
method.tp:docstring: Packages up system logs into a .tar(.gz) and returns it over the supplied file descriptor.

arg.name: is_compressed
arg.tp:docstring: If true, output content should be compressed (.tar.gz), otherwise output content is uncompressed (.tar).

arg.name: outfd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to emit the .tar.gz file over.

method.name: SetDebugMode
method.tp:docstring: Enables or disables debug mode for a specified subsystem.

arg.name: subsystem
arg.tp:docstring: Subsystem to change the debug mode of. One of "cellular", "wifi", "ethernet" or "none".

method.name: GetLog
method.tp:docstring: Fetches the contents of a single system log, identified by name. See /src/log_tool.cc for a list of valid names.

method.name: GetAllLogs
method.tp:docstring: Returns all the system logs.

method.name: GetFeedbackLogsV2
method.tp:docstring: Fills the system logs for feedback reports in the file whose file descriptor is given. This is used for logs that are so big that they exceed the limits of D-Bus returning them. Provides options to change the scope of the collected logs.

arg.name: outfd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to emit the logs to.

arg.name: username
arg.tp:docstring: Username of the user for which the logs are requested.

arg.name: requested_logs
arg.tp:docstring: The list of log types that will be returned to the caller. The array will contain debugd::FeedbackLogTypes enums. An empty array means all available log types will be included.

method.name: GetFeedbackLogsV3
method.tp:docstring: Fills the system logs for feedback reports in the file whose file descriptor is given. This is used for logs that are so big that they exceed the limits of D-Bus returning them. Provides options to change the scope of the collected logs.

arg.name: outfd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to emit the logs to.

arg.name: username
arg.tp:docstring: Username of the user for which the logs are requested.

arg.name: requested_logs
arg.tp:docstring: The list of log types that will be returned to the caller. The array will contain debugd::FeedbackLogTypes enums. An empty array means all available log types will be included.

method.name: BackupArcBugReport
method.tp:docstring: Retrieves the ARC bug report and saves it in debugd daemon store. If a backup already exists, it is over-written. If backup operation fails, an error is logged.

arg.name: username
arg.tp:docstring: Username or hash of the user for which the report is backed up.

method.name: DeleteArcBugReportBackup
method.tp:docstring: Deletes the backed up ARC bug report saved in daemon store. If delete operation fails, an error is logged.

arg.name: username
arg.tp:docstring: Username or hash of the user for which the report is backed up.

method.name: GetExample
method.tp:docstring: Example method. See /doc/hacking.md.

method.name: CupsAddAutoConfiguredPrinter
method.tp:docstring: Add a printer that can be auto-configured to CUPS. Immediately attempt to connect. Returns true if setup was successful.

method.name: CupsAddAutoConfiguredPrinterV2
method.tp:docstring: Add a printer that can be auto-configured to CUPS. Immediately attempt to connect. Returns true if setup was successful.

arg.name: language
arg.tp:docstring: The user's language, expressed in "ll", "ll-CC", or "ll_CC" format. UTF-8 will always be used as the text encoding for printing-related strings.

method.name: CupsAddManuallyConfiguredPrinter
method.tp:docstring: Add a printer to CUPS using the passed PPD contents. Immediately attempt to connect. Returns true if setup was successful.

arg.name: ppd_contents
arg.tp:docstring: The contents of the CUPS Postscript Printer Driver for this printer. This data may optionally be gzip compressed.

method.name: CupsAddManuallyConfiguredPrinterV2
method.tp:docstring: Add a printer to CUPS using the passed PPD contents. Immediately attempt to connect. Returns true if setup was successful.

arg.name: language
arg.tp:docstring: The user's language, expressed in "ll", "ll-CC", or "ll_CC" format. UTF-8 will always be used as the text encoding for printing-related strings.

arg.name: ppd_contents
arg.tp:docstring: The contents of the CUPS Postscript Printer Driver for this printer. This data may optionally be gzip compressed.

method.name: CupsRemovePrinter
method.tp:docstring: Remove a printer from CUPS. Returns true if the printer was removed successfully.

arg.name: name
arg.tp:docstring: The name of the printer to remove.

method.name: CupsRetrievePpd
method.tp:docstring: Retrieve the PPD from CUPS for a given printer. On success, returns the PPD as a vector of bytes. On error, returns an empty vector.

arg.name: name
arg.tp:docstring: The name of the printer to retrieve the PPD.

method.name: GetInterfaces
method.tp:docstring: Returns information about network interfaces as a JSON string.

method.name: TestICMP
method.tp:docstring: Tests ICMP connectivity to a specified host.

method.name: TestICMPWithOptions
method.tp:docstring: Tests ICMP connectivity to a specified host (with options).

method.name: BatteryFirmware
method.tp:docstring: Runs BatteryFirmware utility.

arg.name: option
arg.tp:docstring: Option to pass to the BatteryFirmware command: info: Get Battery Firmware Info. check: Check if AC Adapter is connected. update: Trigger Battery Firmware Update.

arg.name: result
arg.tp:docstring: Battery command output.

method.name: Smartctl
method.tp:docstring: Runs Smartctl utility.

arg.name: option
arg.tp:docstring: Option to pass to the Smartctl command: abort_test: aborts the offline test. attributes: prints device attributes. capabilities: prints generic smart capabilities. error: prints device error messages. health: prints device health status. selftest: prints offline test results. short_test: starts a short offline test.

arg.name: result
arg.tp:docstring: Smartctl command output.

method.name: Mmc
method.tp:docstring: Runs mmc utility.

arg.name: option
arg.tp:docstring: Option to pass to the mmc command: extcsd_read: print extcsd data from root device. extcsd_dump: print raw extcsd data from root device.

arg.name: result
arg.tp:docstring: `mmc` command output.

method.name: Ufs
method.tp:docstring: Runs ufs-related operations over various utilities.

arg.name: option
arg.tp:docstring: Possible options: info: uses smartctl to query device info short_self_test: SCSI SEND DIAGNOSTICS for default self-test.

arg.name: result
arg.tp:docstring: Output of an operation performed over a ufs device.

method.name: Nvme
method.tp:docstring: Runs nvme utility.

arg.name: option
arg.tp:docstring: Option to pass to the nvme command: identify_controller: prints nvme device identity data. short_self_test: launches short-time nvme self-test. long_self_test: launches long-time nvme self-test. stop_self_test: stops nvme self-test.

arg.name: result
arg.tp:docstring: `nvme` command output.

method.name: NvmeLog
method.tp:docstring: Runs nvme utility to fetch log message.

arg.name: page_id
arg.tp:docstring: ID of desired log page in NVMe controller.

arg.name: length
arg.tp:docstring: Required length of byte-data.

arg.name: raw_binary
arg.tp:docstring: Flag to NVMe controller for raw binary output.

arg.name: result
arg.tp:docstring: `nvme` command output.

method.name: MemtesterStart
method.tp:docstring: Starts running memtester.

arg.name: outfd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to send output to.

arg.name: memory
arg.tp:docstring: The amount of memory to allocate and test in megabytes.

arg.name: status
arg.tp:docstring: Opaque handle to the memtester.

method.name: MemtesterStop
method.tp:docstring: Stops running memtester.

arg.name: handle
arg.tp:docstring: Handle to the memtester to stop. If an empty string is passed, stops all running memtests.

method.name: BadblocksStart
method.tp:docstring: Starts running badblocks test.

arg.name: outfd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to send output to.

arg.name: status
arg.tp:docstring: Opaque handle to the badblocks.

method.name: BadblocksStop
method.tp:docstring: Stops running badblocks.

arg.name: handle
arg.tp:docstring: Handle to the badblocks to stop. If an empty string is passed, stops all running badblocks.

method.name: PacketCaptureStart
method.tp:docstring: Starts a packet capture with the specified options, with diagnostic status directed to the "statfd" file descriptor and packet capture data sent to the "outfd" file descriptor. The returned opaque string functions as a handle for this particular packet capture. Multiple captures can be running at once. Captures can be initiated on Ethernet-like devices or WiFi devices in "client mode" (showing only Ethernet frames) by specifying the "device" parameter (see below). By specifying a channel, the script will find or create a "monitor mode" interface if one is available and produce an "over the air" packet capture. The name of the output packet capture file is sent to the output file descriptor.

arg.name: statfd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to send status information to.

arg.name: outfd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to send packet capture output to.

arg.name: options
arg.tp:docstring: Options to pass to the packet capture command. Accepted keys include: device (string): An existing device to perform a packet capture on. frequency (int): Radio frequency (in MHz) to perform capture on. ht_location (string): The string "above" or "below", representing the offset of any secondary channel used in a 40 MHz HT (high throughput) caputre. monitor_connection_on (string): Instead of providing the "frequency" and "ht_location" parameters above, this paramter specifies the name of a currently connected 802.11 interface. A packet capture is initated on the same channel as this connection. Frequency-based capture options are only available in developer mode. Unrecognized keys return a DBus error and print no output to the supplied file descriptor.

arg.name: handle
arg.tp:docstring: Opaque handle for this packet capture.

method.name: PacketCaptureStop
method.tp:docstring: Stops a running packet capture.
method.arg: Handle to the packet capture to stop. If an empty string is passed, stops all running packet captures.

method.name: LogKernelTaskStates
method.tp:docstring: Triggers show-task-states(T) SysRq. See https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/sysrq.txt.

method.name: UploadCrashes
method.tp:docstring: Triggers uploading of system crashes (the crash_sender program).

method.name: UploadSingleCrash
method.tp:docstring: Uploads a single crash report immediately. Crash report data is contained in the message.

arg.name: files
arg.tp:docstring: Array of files to include in the crash report. String is the base file name.

arg.name: consent_already_checked_by_crash_reporter
arg.tp:docstring: If true, the caller is asserting that it is crash_reporter and that it has already checked for consent, so crash_sender does not need to do an additional consent check.

method.name: SetCrashSenderTestMode
method.tp:docstring: If set to true, any UploadSingleCrash call will invoke crash_sender with --test_mode. Avaialble only on dev mode devices.

arg.name: mode
arg.tp:docstring: New mode to be set.

method.name: RemoveRootfsVerification
method.tp:docstring: Removes rootfs verification. Requires a system reboot before it will take effect. Restricted to pre-owner dev mode.

method.name: EnableBootFromUsb
method.tp:docstring: Enables OS booting from a USB image. Restricted to pre-owner dev mode.

method.name: ConfigureSshServer
method.tp:docstring: Sets up sshd to provide an SSH server immediately and on future reboots. Also installs the test SSH keys to allow access by cros tools. Requires that rootfs verification has been removed. Restricted to pre-owner dev mode.

method.name: SetUserPassword
method.tp:docstring: Sets both the system and dev mode password for the indicated account. Restricted to pre-owner dev mode.

arg.name: username
arg.tp:docstring: Username to set the new password for.

arg.name: password
arg.tp:docstring: Password to assign.

method.name: EnableChromeRemoteDebugging
method.tp:docstring: Sets up Chrome for remote debugging. It will take effect after a reboot and using port 9222. Requires that rootfs verification has been removed. Restricted to pre-owner dev mode.

method.name: EnableChromeDevFeatures
method.tp:docstring: Convenience function to enable a predefined set of tools from the Chrome UI. Equivalent to calling these functions in order: 1. EnableBootFromUsb() 2. ConfigureSshServer() 3. SetUserPassword("root", root_password) Requires that rootfs verification has been removed. If any sub-function fails, this function will exit with an error without attempting any further configuration or rollback. Restricted to pre-owner dev mode.

arg.name: root_password
arg.tp:docstring: Password to assign to the root user. If the string is empty, it will default to "test0000".

method.name: QueryDevFeatures
method.tp:docstring: Queries which dev features have been enabled. Each dev feature will be indicated by a bit flag in the return value. Flags are defined in the DevFeatureFlag enumeration. If the dev tools are unavailable (system is not in dev mode/pre-login state), the DEV_FEATURES_DISABLED flag will be set and the rest of the bits will always be set to 0.

arg.name: features
arg.tp:docstring: Feature enabled flags or DEV_FEATURES_DISABLED flag.

tp:enum.name: DevFeatureFlag
tp:enum.tp:docstring: Bit flags representing individual development features. Currently dbusxx-xml2cpp does not extract enum values, so any changes here should be manually flushed to platform/system_api/dbus/service_constants.h.

tp:enumvalue.tp:docstring: Dev features query is unavailable due to access restrictions.
Rootfs verification has been removed, including the required system reset.
Booting from USB has been enabled.
The SSH server has been configured to auto-start on boot and the test SSH keys have been installed. Both of these conditions must be met for this flag to be signaled.
The devmode root account password has been set.
The system root account password has been set.
The Chrome remote debugging feature has been enabled. Chrome will be listening on port 9222. The port is not publicly accessible. User needs to use SSH port forwarding to be able to access it.

method.name: EnableDevCoredumpUpload
method.tp:docstring: Allow uploading of device coredump files.

method.name: DisableDevCoredumpUpload
method.tp:docstring: Disallow uploading of device coredump files.

method.name: SetOomScoreAdj
method.tp:docstring: Set OOM score by writing scores to procfs /proc/pid/oom_score_adj. It is an operation which needs root privilege so needs to be handled carefully: 1. Only user chronos can request the operation. 2. It can only modify processes owned by chronos or run in Android container.

arg.name: scores
arg.tp:docstring: Arrays of (pid, score) pairs.

arg.name: out
arg.tp:docstring: Output from the helper of the operation. Empty on success.

method.name: SwapEnable
method.tp:docstring: Enable swap file usage via config files.
method.arg: Free-form text reporting status.

arg.name: size
arg.tp:docstring: Size (in MB) for the swap file.

arg.name: change_now
arg.tp:docstring: Whether to enable immediately, or wait until next reboot.

method.name: SwapDisable
method.tp:docstring: Disable swap file usage via config files.
method.arg: Free-form text reporting status.

arg.name: change_now
arg.tp:docstring: Whether to disable immediately, or wait until next reboot.

method.name: KstaledSetRatio
method.tp:docstring: Sets the ratio to use for kstaled, 0 will disable the feature. The kstaled ratio is a control of how aggressively kstaled will attempt to swap, higher values are more aggressive and consume more CPU.

arg.name: ratio
arg.tp:docstring: The kstaled ratio to use.

method.name: SwapStartStop
method.tp:docstring: Turn swap usage on/off (leaves config files alone).
method.arg: Free-form text reporting status.

arg.name: on
arg.tp:docstring: Whether to turn it on or off.

method.name: SwapStatus
method.tp:docstring: Show current swap status.
method.arg: Free-form text reporting status.

method.name: SwapSetParameter
method.tp:docstring: Persistently change the value of various parameters.
method.arg: Free-form text reporting status.

arg.name: command_name
arg.tp:docstring: The name of the swap subcommand, usually set_something.

arg.name: value
arg.tp:docstring: The unsigned integer value that some parameter is set to.

method.name: SwapZramEnableWriteback
method.tp:docstring: Enable writeback of zram swapped pages.

arg.name: size_mb
arg.tp:docstring: The size in MB of the zram writeback device to use. Valid values are (0mb, 32000mb].

method.name: SwapZramMarkIdle
method.tp:docstring: Mark pages as idle which have been in zram for |age| in seconds.

arg.name: age
arg.tp:docstring: The |age| in seconds of pages to mark as idle. Valid values are [0s, 259200s (30 days)].

method.name: SwapZramSetWritebackLimit
method.tp:docstring: Set the zram writeback page limit to |limit| pages.

arg.name: limit
arg.tp:docstring: The number of pages which zram can writeback in a single writeback.

method.name: InitiateSwapZramWriteback
method.tp:docstring: Initiate a zram writeback using the provided |mode|.

arg.name: mode
arg.tp:docstring: The type of writeback to issue the legal values are provided by the enumeration ZramWritebackMode.

method.name: SwapSetSwappiness
method.tp:docstring: Set the /proc/sys/vm/swappiness to the provided |swappiness_value|.

arg.name: swappiness_value
arg.tp:docstring: The swappiness value with valid range: [0, 100].

tp:enum.name: ZramWritebackMode
tp:enum.tp:docstring: The valid modes available to use for zram writeback.

tp:enumvalue.tp:docstring: Writeback only pages which have already been marked as idle.
Writeback pages which are huge, these are incompressible.
Writeback pages which are both idle and huge.

method.name: SetU2fFlags
method.tp:docstring: Modify u2fd daemon debugging/override flags.

arg.name: flags
arg.tp:docstring: Flags (comma separated) to force debugging features. See debugd::u2f_flags in system_api for supported flags.

method.name: GetU2fFlags
method.tp:docstring: Get u2fd daemon debugging/override flags.

arg.name: flags
arg.tp:docstring: Flags (comma separated) that are currently set. See debugd::u2f_flags in system_api for supported flags.

method.name: ContainerStarted
method.tp:docstring: Notify debugd that a container is starting up.

method.name: ContainerStopped
method.tp:docstring: Notify debugd that a container has stopped.

method.name: SetWifiPowerSave
method.tp:docstring: Enable/disable WiFi power save mode.

arg.name: enable
arg.tp:docstring: Whether to enable or disable.

method.arg: New power save mode, or error.

method.name: GetWifiPowerSave
method.tp:docstring: Show current WiFi power save mode.
method.arg: Current power save mode.

method.name: RunShillScriptStart
method.tp:docstring: Run a shill debug script in a sandboxed environment.

arg.name: outfd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to send output to.

arg.name: script
arg.tp:docstring: The script to run.

arg.name: script_args
arg.tp:docstring: The command line flags to pass to the script.

arg.name: handle
arg.tp:docstring: Opaque handle for this run.

method.name: RunShillScriptStop
method.tp:docstring: Stops a running script.
method.arg: Handle to the script to stop.

method.name: StartVmPluginDispatcher
method.tp:docstring: Starts the VM Plugin Dispatcher service. Returns true if the service was successfully started and is available over dbus, false otherwise.
method.arg: Cryptohome ID of the user owning the session that will own this dispatcher instance.
Language that user owning the session has selected for the UI to be passed to the dispatcher instance.
Whether the VM Plugin dispatcher service is ready to handle requests.

method.name: StopVmPluginDispatcher
method.tp:docstring: Stops the VM Plugin dispatcher service.

method.name: SetRlzPingSent
method.tp:docstring: Sets should_send_rlz_ping in RW_VPD to 0. Upon success, proceeds to remove rlz_embargo_end_date in RW_VPD.

method.name: UpdateAndVerifyFWOnUsbStart
method.tp:docstring: Start updating the GSC FW of the USB-connected device (only if the device's FW is not up-to-date) and verifying AP and EC RO FW integrity of the device.

arg.name: outfd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to forward process output to.

arg.name: image_file
arg.tp:docstring: Path to the local Cr50 image file.

arg.name: ro_db_dir
arg.tp:docstring: Path to the local RO descriptor files folder.

arg.name: handle
arg.tp:docstring: Opaque handle for the VerifyRo process.

method.name: UpdateAndVerifyFWOnUsbStop
method.tp:docstring: Stops a running VerifyRo.
method.arg: Handle to the VerifyRo process to stop.

method.name: SetSchedulerConfiguration
method.tp:docstring: Set the scheduler configuration policy.
method.arg: Either "conservative" or "performance".

arg.name: result
arg.tp:docstring: Whether setting the policy was successful.

method.name: EvaluateProbeFunction
method.tp:docstring: Evaluates a probe statement by the runtime_probe helper with pre-defined sandbox options in rootfs.

arg.name: probe_statement
arg.tp:docstring: A JSON string representing a probe function which will be executed by the runtime_probe helper.

arg.name: log_level
arg.tp:docstring: The argument of runtime_probe to control the log level.

arg.name: result_fd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to send the result to.

arg.name: error_fd
arg.tp:docstring: File descriptor to send the error logs to.

method.name: SetSchedulerConfigurationV2
method.tp:docstring: Set the scheduler configuration policy.
method.arg: Either "conservative" or "performance".

Argument to lock the policy till the device is rebooted. Only takes effect if set to true and policy is "conservative". Results in error if set to true and the policy is "performance". Has no effect if set to false.

arg.name: result
arg.tp:docstring: Whether setting the policy, and optionally locking it, was successful. Returns false if locked to "consevative" and the policy argument is "performance". Returns true if policy was locked to "conservative" and the policy argument is "conservative".

arg.name: num_cores_disabled
arg.tp:docstring: The number of logical CPU cores disabled after the D-Bus call is done. This is always populated regardless of whether the |result| argument is true.

method.name: WifiFWDump
method.tp:docstring: Trigger wifi firmware dump.

arg.name: output
arg.tp:docstring: Output message. Indicates success/failure of the command to the user.

method.name: CollectSmartBatteryMetric
method.tp:docstring: Runs the ectool i2cread command with pre-defined sandbox options in rootfs and retrieves the requested smart battery metric used by cros_healthd.

arg.name: metric_name
arg.tp:docstring: The name of the smart battery cros_healthd wants to collect. Examples include manufacture_date_smart and temperature_smart.

arg.name: output
arg.tp:docstring: Output of the ectool i2cread command.

method.name: EcGetInventory
method.tp:docstring: Runs the 'ectool inventory' command with pre-defined sandbox options in rootfs and returns the output.
method.arg: Returns the output of the 'ectool inventory' command.

method.name: CallDmesg
method.tp:docstring: Runs the command 'dmesg' with the given inputs.

arg.name: options
arg.tp:docstring: Options to pass to the dmesg command: show-delta (bool): Display the timestamp and the time delta spent between messages. human (bool): Enable human-readable output. kernel (bool): Print kernel messages. force-prefix (bool): Add facility, level or timestamp information to each line of a multi-line message. raw (bool): Print the raw message buffer. ctime (bool): Print human-readable timestamps. notime (bool): Do not print kernel's timestamps. userspace (bool): Print userspace messages. decode (bool): Decode facility and level (priority) numbers to human-readable prefixes. tail (uint32): Only return the last # lines.

method.arg: Returns the output of the 'dmesg' command.

method.name: EcTypeCEnterMode
method.tp:docstring: Runs the 'ectool typeccontrol' command with pre-defined sandbox options in rootfs to enter a USB Type-C mode on the specified port.

arg.name: port_num
arg.tp:docstring: The index number of the port for which the enter mode command will be run. This wil be used in the ectool command without changes.

arg.name: mode
arg.tp:docstring: The mode number argument specifying the mode to be entered. This will be used in the ectool command directly without changes.

method.arg: Returns the output of the 'ectool typeccontrol' command.

method.name: EcTypeCExitMode
method.tp:docstring: Runs the 'ectool typeccontrol' command with pre-defined sandbox options in rootfs to exit a USB Type-C mode on the specified port.

arg.name: port_num
arg.tp:docstring: The index number of the port for which the exit mode command will be run. This wil be used in the ectool command without changes.

method.arg: Returns the output of the 'ectool typeccontrol' command.

method.name: EcTypeCDpState
method.tp:docstring: Runs the 'ectool usbpdmuxinfo' command with pre-defined sandbox options in rootfs to determine the DisplayPort(DP) state for a specified port.

arg.name: port_num
arg.tp:docstring: The index number of the port for which the usbpdmuxinfo command will be run. This wil be used in the ectool command without changes.

method.arg: Returns whether the Type-C port is in DP mode or not.

method.name: EcTypeCHpdState
method.tp:docstring: Runs the 'ectool gpioget' command with pre-defined sandbox options in rootfs to determine the DisplayPort Hot Plug Detect (HPD) GPIO state for a specified port.

arg.name: port_num
arg.tp:docstring: The index number of the port for which the gpioget command will be run. This wil be used in the ectool command without changes.

method.arg: Returns whether the Type-C port has the HPD GPIO set or not.

method.name: KernelFeatureEnable
method.tp:docstring: Execute a sequence of commands to enable a kernel feature.

arg.name: name
arg.tp:docstring: The name of the feature to enable.

arg.name: result
arg.tp:docstring: The result of the method call (success or fail).

arg.name: err_str
arg.tp:docstring: An err_str that describing the reasons for failure.

method.name: KernelFeatureList
method.tp:docstring: Get a CSV list of kernel features that are available to be enabled.

arg.name: result
arg.tp:docstring: The result of the method call (success or fail).

arg.name: csv
arg.tp:docstring: The CSV result or an error string that describing the reasons for failure.

method.name: DRMTraceSetCategories
method.tp:docstring: Set the log categories to enable for drm_trace.

arg.name: categories
arg.tp:docstring: A bitwise OR of categories to enable. Acceptable values are defined in the DRMTraceCategories flags. Setting |categories| to '0' will reset to the default categories.

method.name: DRMTraceSetSize
method.tp:docstring: Modify the size of the drm_trace buffer.

arg.name: size
arg.tp:docstring: The size as defined in the DRMTraceSize enum.

method.name: DRMTraceAnnotateLog
method.tp:docstring: Append a string to the drm_trace log by writing |log| to /sys/kernel/debug/trace/instances/drm/trace_marker Characters that are not human-readable will be filtered out and replaced with '_'.

arg.name: log
arg.tp:docstring: Log contents to append.

method.name: DRMTraceSnapshot
method.tp:docstring: Copy the current contents of the specified log type to a new file /var/log/display_debug/$logtype.$datetimestamp

arg.name: type
arg.tp:docstring: Which log to snapshot as defined in the DRMSnapshotType enum.

method.name: PrintscanDebugSetCategories
method.tp:docstring: Collect printscan debug logs for the specified categories. If no categories are specified, disable log collection for all categories.

arg.name: categories
arg.tp:docstring: A bitwise OR of categories to enable. Acceptable values are defined in the PrintscanDebugCategories flags. Setting |categories| to '0' will disable additional logging.

tp:flags.name: DRMTraceCategories
tp:flags.tp:docstring: Bit flags representing debug logging categories. Definitions of categories correspond to those in https://elixir.bootlin.com/linux/v5.14.12/source/include/drm/drm_print.h#L277 Currently dbusxx-xml2cpp does not extract flags values, so any changes here should be manually flushed to platform2/system_api/dbus/debugd/dbus-constants.h.

tp:enum.name: DRMTraceSize
tp:enum.tp:docstring: Enum values for drm_trace log size. Currently dbusxx-xml2cpp does not extract flags values, so any changes here should be manually flushed to platform2/system_api/dbus/debugd/dbus-constants.h.

tp:enumvalue.tp:docstring: Set the size of the drm_trace buffer to its default value.
Increase the size of the drm_trace buffer to allow for collecting more verbose logs and a longer history of logs.

tp:enum.name: DRMSnapshotType
tp:enum.tp:docstring: Enum values for different logs to snapshot in the context of DRMTrace. Currently dbusxx-xml2cpp does not extract flags values, so any changes here should be manually flushed to platform2/system_api/dbus/debugd/dbus-constants.h.

tp:flags.name: PrintscanDebugCategories
tp:flags.tp:docstring: Bit flags representing debug logging categories. Currently dbusxx-xml2cpp does not extract flags values, so any changes here should be manually flushed to system_api/dbus/debugd/dbus-constants.h

signal.name: PacketCaptureStart
signal.tp:docstring: The signal is emitted when a packet capture process starts in debugd. The signal is expected to be received by Chrome to send a notification to the user to indicate the ongoing packet capture.

signal.name: PacketCaptureStop
signal.tp:docstring: The signal is emitted when the packet capture process is stopped in debugd. The signal is expected to be received by Chrome to close the notification about packet capture.
